    GoapAgent.java --- The Agent which controls a units actions

    P H - 28.01.2017

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()

      • createPlanner

        protected abstract IGoapPlanner createPlanner()
        Function for subclasses to provide an instance of an planner which is going to be used to create the action Queue.
        Returns:
        the used planner instance implementing the IGoapPlanner interface.

      • getAssignedGoapUnit

        public IGoapUnit getAssignedGoapUnit()

      • onPlanCreated

        public void onPlanCreated(java.util.Queue<GoapAction> plan)
        This event is needed to push real action Queues on the FSM-Stack. Has to pop the FSM-Stack, since the event fires before the return value of the state gets checked.
        Parameters:
        plan - the plan that the Planner has created and is ready to be executed.

      • onImportantUnitGoalChange

        public void onImportantUnitGoalChange(GoapState newGoalState)
        This event is needed to change a current goal to a new one, while keeping the old one on the FSM-Stack for its later execution. The importance is set to the highest possible value to ensure that the given goal is the main one of the unit. This causes the Idle Stack to create a Queue specifically for this GoapState, which is empty if no valid Queue is found (null not possible since that would result in the IdleState to try until one is found). The empty Queue causes the unit to proceed with its previous action.
        Parameters:
        newGoalState - the new goal that the GoapUnit is going to accomplish.

      • onImportantUnitStackResetChange

        public void onImportantUnitStackResetChange()
        Event emitted by the GoapUnit if the Actions on the FSM-Stack must reset.

      • onPlanFailed

        public void onPlanFailed(java.util.Queue<GoapAction> actions)
        Gets called when a RunActionState on the FSM throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        actions - the rest of the action Queue which failed to execute.

      • onPlanFinished

        public void onPlanFinished()
        Gets called when a RunActionState on the FSM returns true and therefore signals that it is finished.
